text: Binghamton is a city in the U.S. state of New York. It is near Pennsylvania, and sits along the Susquehanna River. In 2020, 47,969 people lived in the city, while 247,138 people lived in the metropolitan area. In the past, Binghamton was known for making cigars, shoes, and computers. IBM started in the Binghamton area. The area is home to Binghamton University. In 2009, a man shot 13 people and himself dead. Binghamton is home to the Binghamton Senators hockey team and the Binghamton Mets baseball team. ==References== Category:Cities in New York (state) Category:County seats in New York (state)
title: Binghamton, New York
